latex:
If \[x = \frac { - 1 + i\sqrt3}{2}\qquad\text{and}\qquad y = \frac { - 1 - i\sqrt3}{2},\]where $ i^2 = - 1$, then which of the following is \textit{not} correct?\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ x^5 + y^5 = - 1 \qquad \textbf{(B)}\ x^7 + y^7 = - 1 \qquad \textbf{(C)}\ x^9 + y^9 = - 1$\\
$ \textbf{(D)}\ x^{11} + y^{11} = - 1 \qquad \textbf{(E)}\ x^{13} + y^{13} = - 1$
